013package org.apache.juneau.examples.rest.springboot;
014
015import org.apache.juneau.rest.annotation.*;
016import org.apache.juneau.rest.springboot.*;
017import org.springframework.boot.autoconfigure.SpringBootApplication;
018import org.springframework.boot.builder.*;
019import org.springframework.boot.web.servlet.*;
020import org.springframework.context.annotation.*;
021import org.springframework.stereotype.Controller;
022
023/**
024 * Entry point for Examples REST application when deployed as a Spring Boot application.
025 *
026 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
027 *    <li class='link'><a class="doclink" href="../../../../../../index.html#jrss.Overview">juneau-rest-server-springboot &gt; Overview</a>
028 * </ul>
029 */
030@SpringBootApplication
031@Controller
032public class App {
033
034   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
035   // Entry point
036   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
037
038   /**
039    * Entry point method.
040    * @param args Command-line arguments.
041    */
042   @SuppressWarnings("resource")
043   public static void main(String[] args) {
044      try {
045         new SpringApplicationBuilder(App.class).run(args);
046         System.out.println("Initialized.  App available on http://localhost:5000");
047      } catch (Exception e) {
048         e.printStackTrace();
049      }
050   }
051
052   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
053   // Beans
054   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
055
056   /**
057    * Our root REST bean.
058    * <p>
059    * Note that this must extend from {@link SpringRestServlet} so that child resources can be resolved as Spring
060    * beans.
061    * <p>
062    * All REST objects are attached to this bean using the {@link Rest#children()} annotation.
063    *
064    * @return The root resources REST bean.
065    */
066   @Bean
067   public RootResources getRootResources() {
068      return new RootResources();
069   }
070
071   /**
072    * Optionally return the {@link HelloWorldResource} object as an injectable bean.
073    *
074    * @return The hello-world REST bean.
075    */
076   @Bean
077   public HelloWorldResource getHelloWorldResource() {
078      return new HelloWorldResource();
079   }
080
081   /**
082    * Optionally return an injectable message provider for the {@link HelloWorldResource} class.
083    *
084    * @return The message provider for the hello-world REST bean.
085    */
086   @Bean
087   public HelloWorldMessageProvider getHelloWorldMessageProvider() {
088      return new HelloWorldMessageProvider("Hello Spring injection user!");
089   }
090
091   /**
092    * @param rootResources The root REST resource servlet
093    * @return The servlet registration mapped to "/*".
094    */
095   @Bean
096   public ServletRegistrationBean<jakarta.servlet.Servlet> getRootServlet(RootResources rootResources) {
097      return new ServletRegistrationBean<>(rootResources, "/*");
098   }
099}
